intro: Pentacalia viridialba, commonly known as the green-white pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that store water. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
